meaningMnemonic: You need to look a <radical>tree</radical> in the <radical>eye</radical> to gain a <kanji>mutual</kanji> respect for each other. Stand up straight, look the tree directly in its eye(s). If it looks right back, you know things are mutual.
readingMnemonic: If your respect for the tree is <kanji>mutual</kanji> with the respect the tree feels for you, you'll be able to see the tree's <reading>sou</reading>l (そう). Right now its soul looks pretty sad, like it's trying to say, "Why are your people cutting down all my friends? I thought we had a mutual understanding."
